What stands out here is not the use case, but the structural signal: India is beginning to treat real-time intelligence as national infrastructure rather than enterprise tooling.

When platforms at Swiggy‚Äôs scale fuse logistics, demand patterns and behavioural data into a unified compute fabric, they don‚Äôt just optimize delivery; they reshape the architecture of urban systems, supply chains and labour flows at population scale.

This is the layer where digital capability becomes macro-economic leverage. A fascinating preview of how ‚Äòconvenience infrastructure‚Äô can become part of a country‚Äôs competitiveness stack.
